storyInfo: Chestnut arrives in Siesta in search of obsidian. Faced with a crisis lurking within the mines, what he finds is an answer of his own.

attributes.content: Huh, you want to buy obsidian?
attributes.name: Busy Shopkeeper

attributes.content: Mhm! I see you have all kinds of ores here... but no obsidian.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: I saw something about the Obsidian Festival on a flyer before... Isn't obsidian supposed to be a Siestan specialty?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: The short man flips through a geology manual and shows the Obsidian Festival flyer enclosed within to the shopkeeper.
Next to the crumpled flyer is a sketch of the mineral that he drew himself.
The shopkeeper's nose is buried in the goods awaiting arrangement on the shelves, and he doesn't even lift his head to look.
We can't go around selling the stuff openly, not after the Obsidian Festival.
attributes.name: Busy Shopkeeper

attributes.content: Try your luck elsewhere. I got nothing for you!
attributes.name: Busy Shopkeeper

attributes.content: Wait, music festival? ...I've only heard of the regular Obsidian Festival.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Is... it not a festival for selling obsidian?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: It's not. It's for music addicts to cut loose.
attributes.name: Busy Shopkeeper

attributes.content: Noisy as hell, day in, day out. At least it's finally over now.
attributes.name: Busy Shopkeeper

attributes.content: Um... Would you happen to know where I can find some obsidian then?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: The shopkeeper looks up from his hectic work and peers at the short fellow in front of him.
He is surprised at first, but then shows signs of displeasure.
A kid? ...Didn't I say not to cause trouble at my place?
attributes.name: Busy Shopkeeper

attributes.content: I don't have any obsidian here, so run along back to your mommy now!
attributes.name: Busy Shopkeeper

attributes.content: The shopkeeper slams the door shut, locks it from the inside, and draws the curtains.
The small man scratches his head.
Huh... Did I offend him somehow?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: It's probably because you mentioned obsidian.
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: Some Siestans get real antsy the moment they hear that word, as if they're afraid it'll get them involved in something.
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: Apparently there was a Catastrophe Messenger who hid the volcano's situation and completely tricked everyone.
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: A Catastrophe Messenger... hiding the truth? But why?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Why else? For the money. Long story short, so much obsidian was dug up that it destroyed the environment around the volcano, and now Siesta has to relocate...
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: What a damn shame! When I think about that beautiful beach soon being swallowed up by lava... A tragedy is what it is! Maybe this is the unavoidable fate of the Siestans.
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: So stop looking for obsidian and get a move on! What could possibly be more important than getting outta here before the whole volcano blows?
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: Destroying the environment, lying to the people, and inviting disaster...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: It's nothing like what the flyer said. Is obsidian really such a terrible mineral?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Also... if the Siestans knew in advance that the volcano was going to erupt and had already begun preparing accordingly, then why...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Why does everyone still seem so restless?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Heeheeheheheh... Lemme tell you something, kiddo. In the face of disaster, everyone's going to go through a mix of sensitivity, anxiety, and pain, no matter how well prepared they are.
attributes.name: Mysterious Person

attributes.content: That so-called 'preparation' is nothing more than a false sense of security, a coping mechanism... Heeheeheheh.
attributes.name: Mysterious Person

attributes.content: ...What? Wh-Who are you?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Oh, that hardly matters. What matters is that I know your past. I've also grasped your present and glimpsed into your future.
attributes.name: Mysterious Person

attributes.content: A withered hand stretches out from under the sleeve, presenting a small bone plate.
The mysterious person wobbles the plate around, causing the metal balls upon it roll around, making an indescribable sound when they collide.
He then contorts himself into a strange posture, craning his neck to press his ear against the bone plate as if carefully interpreting some sort of message.
Ohohohoh... I hear it.
attributes.name: Mysterious Person

attributes.content: What a poor, pitiful child you are. From the day the disaster from the skies destroyed your 'burrows,' you were driven towards the frigid cold and scorching sun of the surface.
attributes.name: Mysterious Person

attributes.content: Burrows? They're not burrows, they're our cities. Underground cities. Have you never heard of Durins?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Durins? They're no different from us. We all have our fair share of worries and hardships throughout life.
attributes.name: Mysterious Person

attributes.content: I know what it is you're looking for, and what you're trying to protect. Do not heed the words of others; simply follow your heart, and do as you desire.
attributes.name: Mysterious Person

attributes.content: With the other hand, the person reaches inside his pocket to produce a small stone.
The jet-black crystal seems to absorb all sunlight, diffusing it across its lustrous surface.
Whoa... It's beautiful.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Instead of preparing for disaster, it is better to seek out refuge so that disaster may never again occur.
attributes.name: Mysterious Person

attributes.content: Heheheh... This chunk of obsidian will protect you, but... only if you're willing to pay a small 'price.'
attributes.name: Mysterious Person

attributes.content: (This black stone is certainly quite beautiful... but it doesn't feel like a natural mineral at all.)
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: (Is it really obsidian?)
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: (For all I know, it could just be a piece of glass.)
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Excuse me, sirâ€”
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Oh, I found it! Over here!
attributes.name: Tourist A

attributes.content: Finally, there you are! The swindler with the bone plate!
attributes.name: Tourist B

attributes.content: Trying to scam people with fake goods?! You call this obsidian?
attributes.name: Tourist B

attributes.content: Absolutely. What I sell is 'obsidian'! These are all spiritual stones that ensure peoples' safety. Once sold, they cannot be returned!
attributes.name: Mysterious Person

attributes.content: If what you're after is that accursed rock that brings only calamity, then go dig it up yourself from that volcanic cave!
attributes.name: Mysterious Person

attributes.content: You bastard! Give us back our money, now!
attributes.name: Tourist A

attributes.content: The situation before the short man devolves into a brawl.
The tourists' wallets, the mysterious person's bone plate, and a button ripped from someone's shirt all fly through the air and land nearby.
Along with the 'obsidian,' rolling to a stop at the short man's feet.
He leans over and picks it up.
Hmm...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: It turned darker...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: He takes out the 'obsidian' he had just obtained earlier from his specimen box.
The piece of black glass sinks into the darkness of the cave, and it becomes hard to distinguish its outline.
The short man waves his staff around, brightening the area.
The bone plate guy gave me directions to the real obsidian mine as a thank-you for pulling the two angry tourists off of him.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: It should be right here.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Though this mine's really old, some company has been active here for quite some time, and the ore in the shallow layer is likely on the verge of exhaustion.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: But this place should be safe enough, based on how far it is from the volcano... In any case, I won't know if I can find any obsidian here until I try.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Hmm... Actually, I really need to take a closer look at the geological structure of this cave. These fine, regularly-spaced lines... Were they left behind by lava flows? The thin line bends here, then extends downward...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: ...Which likely means I still need to go a bit deeper. The veins containing ore should be farther down.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: That sound... is that water? ...No.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Behind the pillar... Who's there? Why are you hiding?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: What, it's just a little kid.
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: I'm not a kid! I'm a grown adult!
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: The man frowns.
What'd you come here for? You don't just waltz into an obsidian mine. It's dangerous down here.
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: I'm looking for obsidian veins... I'm a geological surveyor of sorts?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Tch, a surveyor, huh?
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: Where are you from, Victoria or Columbia? What geological institute do you belong to? Or are you with one of those high-and-mighty conservation organizations?
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: You've got the wrong idea, sir... I'm not here on behalf of any organization. Collecting beautiful rocks like obsidian is just a personal hobby.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Hold on... Gah, too bright! Point that thing away from me! What are you doing?!
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: ...Abnormal ridges around the fingernails, and sclera show signs of yellowing, which either means you have some problem with your digestive system, or you haven't eaten in a while.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Also...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: The short man raises his staff, and a faint glow pours out in front of it.
Wh-What's going on? I feel... warmth.
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: You've sprained your leg. Don't worry though, I'll help relieve the muscle fatigue and repair the damaged tissue.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: How do you feel now?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Much better. It doesn't seem to hurt anymore. Are you a doctor, little fella?
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: I don't qualify as a doctor yet, but I do know some basic healing Arts.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: This light can only temporarily relieve your symptoms. If the problems come back and the pain gets worse, you should go see a specialist.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Mm... Appreciate it.
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: Here, I'll help you up.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: The short man reaches over to help pull up the person lying in the corner, but his body is heavier than expected.
He manages to help the man stand up, but the force from being pulled forward nearly makes him topple over.
The little piece of black glass tucked in his pocket falls to the ground with a clinking sound.
Ah! My 'obsidian'!
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Obsidian?
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: Isn't that one of those cheap knock-offs made by Siestan hawkers to trick tourists?
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: They told you this was obsidian?
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: Uhh... Actually, I knew all along that it was a fake.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: The man leans over and picks up the black rock that had fallen onto the ground, pinches it between his thumb and index finger, then taps it against the wall to produce another clinking sound.
Please don't mess with it any more...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: What's the big deal? Isn't this just a piece of black glass? Completely worthless.
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: Here, take it.
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: Yes, but even if it isn't obsidian, it still counts as a beautiful stone.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Every stone has its own value.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: What a strange little fella.
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: How about I show you something actually worth something?
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: The man takes off the cloth bag fastened to his waist and unties the rope. It's filled to the brim with black rocks.
Here, all of this obsidian is yours.
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: Whoa! This is... it's all real obsidian! But...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: You're giving all these to me? Why...?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: As thanks for the treatment you just gave me.
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: Oh... But I don't need all that. I just wanted a little chunk to study in my collection. Just this one's fine.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: You came all the way into this mine just for a tiny little chunk of obsidian... for your collection? To study? You sure?
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: One piece is enough. Combined with the lava markings left in the cave, I have a pretty good idea of where the obsidian veins are.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: What do you need the veins for? Is a whole bag of the stuff not enough for you?
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: Just take it before I change my mind. Won't get a deal this good anywhere.
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: But... isn't all this more valuable to you? I mean, you took a whole lot of risks just to come dig it up.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Oh! I, um... Yeah, I won't tell anyone! Especially not anyone on the lookout for obsidian smugglers.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Also... I won't be in Siesta much longer, now that I've got my hands on the real deal.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: What, you think I'm a smuggler just 'cause of this bag here?
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: Lots of people come here looking for obsidian. Volcanologists, environmental workers, government employers... and folks like you, surveyors who are 'just interested.'
attributes.name: Cautious Man

attributes.content: If you really were some kind of researcher here to monitor volcanic activity, why wouldn't you shout for help when you saw someone coming?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: You hurt your leg and couldn't move, plus it looks like you've been down here without food for quite some time now...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: But even after I found you, you were more worried about who I might be, rather than how I could help you.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: So what else could explain all that, other than being an obsidian smuggler?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Smuggling? What the hell are you talking about? ...My old man was an obsidian miner, so's my brother, and so am I.
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: This is how we make a living. How does that add up to 'smuggling'?
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: Sir... I meant no offense. I'm not qualified to judge Siesta's policies or your actions, nor am I in any position to do so, but...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Doesn't matter anyway.
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: Even if you go running off to tell the police or the people at City Hall or whatever, this is what I gotta do to support my family.
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: But what if the volcano suddenly erupts early?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Who cares? That's way off in the future. How could that happen all of a sudden?
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: Besides, the Siestans have already started moving, so there's still plenty of time.
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: ...But wouldn't it be way too late by the time disaster actually struck?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: My old hometown was destroyed in a sudden disaster. Everything we had worked so hard to build was just gone overnight.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: In order to find out what caused it, my people and I started studying geology. Afterwards, I came to the surface to see how various other people handle their crises.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Seeing Catastrophe Messengers warning people of danger, nomadic cities moving people away from high-risk areas... I really admire that kind of resilience.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Resilience? What do you mean by that?
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: Hmm... I mean being able to bounce back after facing a sudden crisis?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Just like a huge lake. Not only can it store the runoff from a flooding river after a rainy season, but it can also nourish that same river during droughts.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: In that case, why don't you people move to a nomadic city like Siesta, too?
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: If they're all as observant as you, I'm sure you could easily pick out a few capable people to be Catastrophe Messengers.
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: Well... Um, there are actually a lot of things we don't quite understand.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Compared to my hometown, Siesta's a pretty lucky city. After all, the volcano hasn't erupted yet, and there's still plenty of time to avoid the brunt of the disaster.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: I don't have any obsidian here, so run along back to your mommy now!
attributes.name: Busy Shopkeeper

attributes.content: Maybe this is the unavoidable fate of the Siestans... What could possibly be more important than getting outta here before the whole volcano blows?
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: That so-called 'preparation' is nothing more than a false sense of security, a coping mechanism... Heeheeheheh.
attributes.name: Mysterious Person

attributes.content: Even knowing about the disaster doesn't seem to be making life any easier for the Siestans...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: So what do we do...? What can we do when faced with these sudden natural disasters?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Wh-What's going on? It's shaking so much... Don't tell me the volcano's actually about to blow...?
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: I just had to jinx it... There's no way our timing's actually this bad, is there?
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: No, I don't think it should erupt just yet...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: But the structure of this cave is already extremely unstable, and even the slightest volcanic activity could cause it to collapse.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: We need to get out of here, now.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: ...Hah, I reckon that's easier said than done.
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: A swarm of Originium slugs starts approaching from the cave's entrance.
If we head over there, they'll pick our bones clean!
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: Head down! Follow me!
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Well, what now? There are slugs down there too. Stop going down and take that higher passage up there!
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: I'm familiar with that area. Mined obsidian up there a few times! Besides, didn't you say you wanted to check out the obsidian veins? Well, now's your chance!
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: Let's keep going this way.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Is that some kinda sick joke? I ain't dying down here with you!
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: I'm going that way.
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: Before the miner finishes his words, the wall above that cave passage cracks open, and an Originium slug squeezes out from it.
This way! Over here! What are you even doing?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Oh... Coming...
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: Could you tell it was dangerous that way?
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: I know it looks like we're going deeper right now, but I can tell from the lines on the wall that it'll climb back up as we go forward. Plus... the Originium slugs aren't coming this way.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: As for the path up there... Didn't you just say that you mined obsidian from there?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Long-term excavation will absolutely destroy the stability of the rock formation, and it could easily collapse if things start shaking again. Also, after the ore gets dug out, the cavity left behind is the perfect place for a slug nest.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Heh. You've got a little bit of that magic in you, little man.
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: Treating the wounded, observing the environment, guiding an escape, slug-related disasters... Do you do this all the time?
attributes.name: Obsidian Miner

attributes.content: I see light ahead! That should be our way out!
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: After escaping from the mines, Chestnut says goodbye to the obsidian miner.
'Do you do this all the time?'
But disaster still struck... when nobody was ready for it.
The short man cannot help but think: what else can he do? For now, he still can't come up with an answer.
However, he now welcomes two new guests to his specimen box â€” two pieces of beautiful 'obsidian.' That was enough to make him feel at peace.
On his last day in Siesta, Chestnut went to the beach, drank ice-cold soda from a street vendor, felt the sea breeze, and listened to the sound of the waves.
Sitting on the stone steps, he opens up his booklet and starts detailing the hard-earned ore in his hand, recording this unique holiday in the way he's accustomed to.
This time, though, the sound of crying suddenly pierces through the momentary calm of the receding waves.
Is that a little kid?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Is it coming from the beach?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Uwaaaaahâ€”
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Hey! Stop crying! What's the big deal anyway?!
attributes.name: Little Boy

attributes.content: ...Excuse me, what's wrong?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Waaaaahâ€”
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: A big wave just came and messed up our drawing of our big brother!
attributes.name: Little Boy

attributes.content: A drawing of your big brother? Where is it?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Right under your foot.
attributes.name: Little Boy

attributes.content: Chestnut looks down and sees that he's stepping on a drawing in the sand.
Even though it had been washed away by the waves, he can vaguely see the outline of a large head.
Um... How about we draw another one? I can help you out.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Uwaaaaaaaaaah!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Huh? Why's she crying even harder now?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: We can't! Big brother's eyes have been washed away!
attributes.name: Little Boy

attributes.content: His eyes? Why not just draw two more?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: No, the eyes have to be rocks. My little sis went all over the beach looking for the right ones, and finally found two round black pebbles, but the waves took them away!
attributes.name: Little Boy

attributes.content: *sniffle*...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Black pebbles?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: How about these? Will they work?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Chestnut holds out two chunks of obsidianâ€”one real, one fake. The two children come closer and carefully look them over.
Um... This might work?
attributes.name: Little Boy

attributes.content: No, no...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Huh? That's too bad then...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: They... They're not round enough!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Oh, I've got you.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: His staff is once again surrounded with light, which then wraps around the two 'black pebbles.'
Huh?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: The rocks... are round now?
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: So now we've got the eyes. What else do we need?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Draw a big ol' head!
attributes.name: Little Boy

attributes.content: I'll draw the ears, and he'll draw the mouth... Since you're new here, you can just put the eyes in!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: You want me to do it?
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: Hmm, these two rocks...
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: The short man places the two 'black pebbles' inside the sand portrait, and the sound of the children's laughter drifts into his ears.
Under the sunlight, the way they shine... isn't any different.
attributes.name: Chestnut

attributes.content: But, that's not important anymoreâ€”
Right now, they are bright, shining eyes.
Now it's perfect!
attributes.name: Little Girl & Little Boy

attributes.content: The portrait in the sand slowly becomes more and more complete. Apparently, in the minds of these two kids, the brother is... a bit funny-looking.
Phew...
Is it time to head home? To return underground, to return to my people, to build a stronger home together?
The waves may still surge over onto the beach, mercilessly washing away our masterpiece without warning.
But, the big ol' head can be drawn again. And you can always find two more 'black pebbles.'
This time... should be perfect, right?
attributes.name: Chestnut
